sentence.Network_en: Predatory pricing by large supermarkets was threatening the livelihood of smaller businesses.
sentence.Network_cn: 大型超市的掠夺性价格正威胁着小商店的生计。

sentence.Network_en: Communities on the island depended on whaling for their livelihood.
sentence.Network_cn: 岛上的居民靠捕鲸为生。

sentence.Network_en: Appropriate arrangements will be made for their work and livelihood.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的工作和生活会得到妥善安排.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English līflād 'way of life', from līf 'life' + lād 'course' (see lode). The change in the word's form in the 16th cent. was due to association with lively and -hood

entry.def: Your livelihood is the job or other source of income that gives you the money to buy the things you need.

example.ex: ...fishermen who depend on the seas for their livelihood...
As a result of this conflict he lost both his home and his means of livelihood.
example.tran: 这场冲突使他同时失去了住所和生计来源。

means.word_mean: 1. the financial means whereby one lives;

sentences.sentence: "each child was expected to pay for their keep"
"he applied to the state for support"
"he could no longer earn his own livelihood"
